description.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"We must eliminate the barriers that people reentering society face and provide the holistic, community-based services and tools they need to thrive. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

detailPageTitle.pageHeadline: Reimagine reentry to promote dignity and safety for all

richText.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-3","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Every year, more than 600,000 people return home from prison and approximately 9 million leave local jails. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Disproportionately Black, Brown, and low-income, these individuals face extraordinary barriers to success. Not only have they been removed from their families and communities for months or years, they are often barred from housing, employment and licensure, food, living, and education supports. When these resources are available, they require individuals to navigate the administrative, logistical, and digital complexities of various programs instead of having one holistic source of support. These barriers make it exceedingly difficult for returning citizens to thrive following a period of incarceration.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"We must provide returning citizens the holistic, community-based services and tools they need to thrive. We must eliminate the specific barriers that people reentering society face, including employment discrimination, family separation, lack of education and training, barriers to obtaining occupational licenses, bans on participating in social programs and public housing, inadequate access to medical care, and restrictions on voting. This will enable communities to grow stronger and heal from the devastation of mass incarceration.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

content.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Every year, more than 600,000 people return home from prison and approximately 9 million leave local jails. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Eliminate the specific barriers that people reentering society face, including employment discrimination, family separation, lack of education and training, barriers to obtaining occupational licenses, bans on participating in social programs and public housing, inadequate access to medical care, and restrictions on voting. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Develop pathways to successful reintegration into society for people with arrest and conviction records through apprenticeships, fellowships, and other community-based free social programs and supports.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

text.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"We must offer schools a holistic, relationship-focused way to address conflict and build opportunities for students to improve all children’s chances for success.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"We must repair the enormous damage that policies from the War on Drugs have caused, while reinvesting all savings into communities.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}
